description:
Docs: http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-compute/2/content/ProgramaticLimits.html#d6e634
xmlns is supposed to be: "http://docs.openstack.org/common/api/v1.0"
Currently it is: "http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1"

You can reproduce this by making a call to /limits with "accept: application/json" as a header.
title: xml namespace of limits call is incorrect

comments.content:
Docs: http://docs.openstack.org/api/openstack-compute/2/content/ProgramaticLimits.html#d6e634
xmlns is supposed to be: "http://docs.openstack.org/common/api/v1.0"
Currently it is: "http://docs.openstack.org/compute/api/v1.1"

You can reproduce this by making a call to /limits with "accept: application/json" as a header.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~westmaas

comments.content: Just realized this same problem may apply to the versions resource, should be confirmed.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~westmaas

comments.content: gabriel: should the accept header be application/json or application/xml?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~bcwaldon

comments.content: To recreate the issue, yes, that should have been application/xml.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~westmaas

comments.content:
Fix proposed to branch: master
